decks.notes: The deck focuses on quick, aggressive plays by utilizing efficient creatures and disruption spells to control the game and maintain pressure on the opponent. By playing powerful cards like Tarmogoyf, Bloodbraid Elf, and Liliana of the Veil, along with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while developing its own threats. The land base supports the aggressive strategy by providing consistent mana sources to cast spells on curve. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, aggressive game plan.

This UW Control deck focuses on efficiently managing your opponent's threats through countermagic, removal spells, and powerful creatures like Geist of Saint Traft and Restoration Angel. With a combination of card advantage from Snapcaster Mage and Vendilion Clique, along with powerful instant-speed plays like Cryptic Command, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents while controlling the board with cards like Baneslayer Angel and Celestial Colonnade. The deck's land base and disruptive spells allow you to control the pace of the game and dictate the flow of interactions.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of hand disruption spells, removal spells, and powerful creatures to outvalue and outlast the opponent. By utilizing efficient creature removal and hand disruption to disrupt the opponent's game plan, along with powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Vendilion Clique to apply pressure, this deck seeks to control the board and grind out incremental advantages until victory is achieved. The combination of versatile removal spells and disruptive creatures make it difficult for the opponent to execute their game plan effectively.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying a board presence of artifact creatures and utilizing various artifacts to buff them and deal quick damage to the opponent. It uses cards like Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer to enhance the power of its creatures, while also relying on cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to accelerate its mana production. By efficiently combining artifacts and creatures, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive plays to secure victory before the opponent can mount a defense.

The deck focuses on utilizing creatures with powerful ETB abilities to create a toolbox-like strategy, able to adapt to different situations. By utilizing Birthing Pod to search for specific creatures at the right time, the deck aims to generate infinite combos with Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Deceiver Exarch or Zealous Conscripts. The deck also includes disruption and card advantage with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, Spellskite, and Wall of Omens. The key strategy is to efficiently tutor and assemble combos while controlling the board with disruptive creatures.

This Aggro-Affinity deck focuses on using efficient artifact creatures and key artifact spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By combining creatures like Ornithopter and Signal Pest with Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer, the deck can quickly create a lethal threat on the battlefield. The mana acceleration provided by Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum allows for explosive starts, while cards like Arcbound Ravager and Master of Etherium provide additional synergy and power. The deck aims to end the game quickly through aggressive creature attacks and powerful artifact interactions.

The main concept of this UR Storm deck is to quickly build up mana with rituals like Desperate Ritual and Pyretic Ritual, while using cards like Goblin Electromancer and Pyromancer Ascension to reduce the cost of key spells like Grapeshot. The deck seeks to chain together spells using Past in Flames to constantly recur and reuse powerful spells, eventually leading to a large storm count and finishing off the opponent with a lethal Grapeshot. The deck focuses on efficiently drawing through the deck to find the necessary pieces for a game-winning combo.

This deck focuses on assembling the combo of Splinter Twin with Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite, allowing you to create infinite creature tokens with haste. The deck includes a variety of spells to control the opponent's game plan and protect your combo, as well as cantrips to help find your combo pieces. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and provide consistency in casting your spells on curve. With proper sequencing and timing, you can quickly overwhelm your opponent with an unblockable army of tokens.

This deck focuses on using control elements like discard spells, removal, and planeswalkers to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The key strategy involves using Gifts Ungiven to set up a powerful reanimation package, bringing back big threats like Elesh Norn or Iona. The deck also utilizes the graveyard with cards like Snapcaster Mage, Deathrite Shaman, and Life from the Loam. By controlling the board and out-valuing the opponent with card advantage, this deck aims to grind out a win in the late game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently deal poison damage to the opponent using creatures with the infect keyword. The deck utilizes a combination of pump spells, evasion abilities, and protection spells to maximize the effectiveness of the infect creatures like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf. By strategically sequencing spells and attacks, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with poison counters before they can stabilize or mount a defense. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation to ensure it consistently finds the necessary pieces to execute its game plan.

This deck focuses on using creatures with infect to deal poison counters to the opponent and win the game quickly. It utilizes pump spells and protection spells to make sure the infect creatures can get through to the opponent and deal damage. The deck aims to have a fast and aggressive start, overwhelming the opponent before they can set up their defenses. The key strategy is to carefully manage resources and timing to maximize the efficiency of each infect creature's attack and minimize the opponent's ability to counterattack.

This Jund deck focuses on aggressive creature plays with cards like Bloodbraid Elf, Geralf's Messenger, and Tarmogoyf, supported by disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Terminate to control the board. The deck's key strategy is to apply early pressure with efficient creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan, ultimately overwhelming them with a combination of efficient threats and disruption.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost artifacts and creatures, leveraging powerful synergies and pump effects to overwhelm opponents early in the game. By utilizing cards like Arcbound Ravager and Steel Overseer to boost the power of its creatures, combined with Cranial Plating for additional damage, the deck aims to quickly close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. Additionally, cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum help ramp up mana production to deploy threats faster, creating a strong aggro strategy that can be difficult to deal with.

The main concept of this Aggro - Affinity deck is to quickly flood the board with low-cost artifacts such as Memnite and Ornithopter, then pump them up with cards like Steel Overseer and Cranial Plating to deal maximum damage to the opponent. Cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum help ramp up mana quickly for explosive plays, while cards like Galvanic Blast provide extra reach for finishing off the opponent. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy while leveraging the synergy between artifacts to gain a competitive edge.

The deck focuses on using cheap spells to quickly build up storm count and generate enough mana to cast a lethal Grapeshot. The key strategy involves using cards like Goblin Electromancer and Pyromancer Ascension to reduce the cost of spells and double their effects, while also utilizing recursion spells like Past in Flames to replay key spells from the graveyard. The deck aims to efficiently draw through the library with cantrips like Serum Visions and Sleight of Hand to find the pieces needed to execute the combo and win the game in one explosive turn.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and efficient creatures. By utilizing cards like Snapcaster Mage to reuse spells and Celestial Colonnade as a win condition, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in a longer game. Geist of Saint Traft provides a quick clock while Vendilion Clique disrupts opponents' hands. Restoration Angel provides additional value by blinking creatures like Kitchen Finks. The deck excels at disrupting opponents' strategies and grinding out victories through incremental advantage and resource management.
